alert.note: Alert for Alfalfa; Grant; Kay (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 21 at 7:55AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Kay, northeastern Alfalfa and northern Grant Counties through 845 AM CDT... At 755 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Viola to 4 miles southwest of Conway Springs to near Anthony to 4 miles southeast of Attica. Movement was southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Medford, Wakita, Braman, Deer Creek, Manchester, Amorita, Byron, Renfrow, Waldron, and Blackwell Lake. This includes Interstate 35 between mile markers 228 and 236. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
